summary: The Advancing Grid-Enhancing Technologies Act of 2025 aims to incentivize the deployment of grid-enhancing technologies (GETs) to improve the efficiency and capacity of the electric grid. The bill directs the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) to establish a shared savings incentive, returning a portion of savings from GET investments to developers. It also mandates the collection and public availability of congestion management data and directs the Secretary of Energy to create an application guide and provide technical assistance to promote GET implementation. The bill includes authorization of appropriations for these initiatives.
